backend.integrations.hubspot module

async backend.integrations.hubspot.authorize_hubspot(user_id, org_id)[source]

Initiates the HubSpot OAuth2 authorization flow.

Generates a unique state, stores it in Redis, and returns the HubSpot authorization URL.

Parameters:

  • user_id (str) – The ID of the user initiating the authorization.

  • org_id (str) – The ID of the organization.

Returns:

The HubSpot authorization URL.

Return type:

str

async backend.integrations.hubspot.oauth2callback_hubspot(request: Request)[source]

Handles the OAuth2 callback from HubSpot.

Validates the state, exchanges the authorization code for an access token, and stores the credentials in Redis.

Parameters:

request (fastapi.Request) – The FastAPI request object containing query parameters.

Raises:

HTTPException – If an OAuth error occurs, state mismatch, or token exchange fails.

Returns:

An HTML response to close the browser window.

Return type:

fastapi.responses.HTMLResponse

async backend.integrations.hubspot.get_hubspot_credentials(user_id, org_id)[source]

Retrieves HubSpot credentials for a given user and organization from Redis.

Deletes the credentials from Redis after retrieval.

Parameters:

  • user_id (str) – The ID of the user.

  • org_id (str) – The ID of the organization.

Raises:

HTTPException – If no credentials are found.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the HubSpot credentials.

Return type:

dict

async backend.integrations.hubspot.create_integration_item_metadata_object(response_json)[source]

Creates an IntegrationItem object from HubSpot contact response data.

Parameters:

response_json (dict) – The JSON response data for a HubSpot contact.

Returns:

An IntegrationItem object representing the HubSpot contact.

Return type:

IntegrationItem

async backend.integrations.hubspot.get_items_hubspot(credentials) → list[dict][source]

Fetches HubSpot contacts for a given set of credentials.

Checks for cached contacts in Redis. If not found, fetches from HubSpot API, creates IntegrationItem objects, and caches the results.

Parameters:

credentials (str) – A JSON string containing the HubSpot access token.

Raises:

HTTPException – If fetching contacts fails or an unexpected error occurs.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries, each representing a HubSpot contact.

Return type:

list[dict]
